title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

After breaching $50,000, Bitcoin's price pulled back on Feb. 13 after the U.S. government reported hotter-than-expected inflation. Nevertheless, crypto market greed is back with a vengeance as the index tracking sentiment reached its highest level since 2021, and the Ethereum ETF race hots up as Franklin Templeton becomes the latest firm to apply. 

Bitcoin and the broader cryptocurrency market declined on Feb. 13, as investors reacted to a stronger than expected U.S. inflation report, which potentially ruled out the possibility of a March rate cut.

The BTC price fell by nearly 4% to $48,435, according to data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and TradingView. It later recovered above $49,000.

Read more

title: Ripple Aims to Expand Regulatory Reach With Standard Custody Acquisition
description: In a strategic move to bolster its regulatory credentials, Ripple has announced its plan to acquire Standard Custody & Trust Company. This acquisition, pending regulatory approval, is set to enhance Ripple’s portfolio of digital asset solutions and regulatory licenses, marking a significant step in the company’s expansion. title: BONKbot, Birdeye partner to enhance Solana trading experience
description: Telegram trading bot BONKbot has partnered with Birdeye to help Solana-based traders access advanced analytics and execute trades seamlessly.

title: Up to Life Imprisonment in Store for Perpetrators of Crypto Crimes, According to New Rules From Korea Government
description:
Breaking crypto laws in South Korea could soon come with a steep punishment. The country’s new “Virtual Asset User Protection Act,” which is primed to come into effect in July, prohibits crypto market manipulation, certain types of trading and the use of undisclosed important information regarding digital assets. Violating those regulations and earning an illegal […]

title: Ethereum and Cardano Lead Institutional Altcoin Inflows As $1,100,000,000 Hits Crypto ETPs: CoinShares
description:
Digital assets manager CoinShares says institutions poured $1.1 billion into crypto investment products one month after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) approved spot BTC exchange-traded funds (ETFs). In its latest Digital Asset Fund Flows report, CoinShares finds that crypto investment products saw over a billion dollars in inflows last week and show no signs […]

The post Ethereum and Cardano Lead Institutional Altcoin Inflows As $1,100,000,000 Hits Crypto ETPs: CoinShares appeared first on The Daily Hodl.
